main event: An unidentified witness observed a dark, barrel-shaped object that appeared to fall straight down to the earth in Codroy, Newfoundland.
interesting points: The observed object was six to eight feet long and had a tail of flames measuring six to eight feet long., The sighting lasted for a duration of 5 minutes with 3 minutes of direct observation., The event occurred on 19 March 1960 at 1800 hours., The object was reported to be black to blue in color and made no sound., The sighting was classified as 'insufficient data' due to having only one witness, leading to uncertainty regarding its identification as a meteor or an astronomical event.
sighted object: dark, barrel-shaped object with flames trailing
